title: How do I convert ALL of my Outlook to Thunderbird
content:
Hi - I have been looking for over 2 days. How do I import all my data (emails, addresses calendar) from Outlook to Thunderbird.

I have tried Import tool within Thunderbird - import from Outlook. I tried MailStore and was totally confused - the terminology was strange. I managed to make an archive - it took ages to find where it was and I still do not know the file extension.

No videos...nothing.

Thanks
creator: orangewatchcompany

title: Display goes wrong on external display
content:
When using an external display, only Thunderbird may appear larger. (See attached image.) 

This phenomenon does not appear on all displays, but only when using a Philips monitor.

Since this problem appears only in Thunderbird, it cannot be solved by changing the resolution of the PC.

Also, even if it is Philips, the display may still be correct. Rebooting does not solve the problem. The same phenomenon occurs with mirroring.

Please let me know if you know of any solution to this problem, as I will describe my operating environment below.

Thunderbird 128.6.1esr (64ビット)

--PC MacBook Pro (12-inch, M1, 2020) macOS Big Sur 11.3

--Display PHILIPS 271E1

--How to connect to the external display

MacBookPro 

- Anker PowerExpand 6-in-1 USB-C PD (Hub) - HDMI cable - Philips 17inch display
creator: a.homma.lostarrow

title: Thunderbird
content: Hi All Have been using Thunderbird since early 1990. Somehow I lost the tool bar that has reply and forward. How can I restore this feature? Roy
creator: Arceenut

title: CalDAV: Item changed on server: How do i disable the PopUp?
content:
Hello,

I have several CalDAV calendars from my Nextcloud server integrated into my Thunderbird 128.6.1esr (64-bit) on Windows 11 24H2. I synchronize every minute. Sometimes, when opening Thunderbird, a message "Item changed on server" appears with the options "Submit my changes anyway" or "Discard my changes and reload".

By default, Thunderbird adopts the server entry. I notice this when I simply close the dialog with "x". For me, the calendar items on the server always have priority. Therefore, my question is, can I set this through the Config Editor so that this pop-up is not displayed? This way, the server entries are always automatically loaded in the background. I can't find a suitable solution, which has somewhat surprised me.

Attached is a screenshot from my documentation, hence the red rectangles.

Thank you very much!
creator: serjoscha

title: thunderbird esr 128.6.0 forwarding external mails are empty
content:
Hello,

i noticed with some thunderbird esr 128.6.0 ESR installations that if a user tries to forward a mail the mail is empty. Usually there should be the mail text and attachments, but its completly empty. We tried to send the mail to see if its just a visbility error, but the mail arrives empty too. This mostly happens with external mails. Internal mails still work as they should.

Any suggestions?

Many Thanks!
creator: akalinski

title: Mail in arrivo
content: Le mail ricevute non lette bloccano il programma, impedendo la possibilità di leggerle. Grazie Livio Moracchiato Dafo

title: Disable "Uninvited guest" warning
content:
We use Thunderbird at work. Invitations to meetings go usually to several people via internal email lists. Whenever people send invitations to meetings via these lists, and I accept these invitations, I receive the notification

"Uninvited Guest The email address associated with the calendar you are importing this invitation to is not on the guest list. Associate this event with [my address]"

Is it possible to deactivate this message? It is super annoying when you get several invitations per day and need to confirm the same question each time.
creator: random_bystander
